name: Aria Chen
core_wound: Unknowable past - her own memories are fabricated, leaving her without authentic identity
wants: To find her original memories and discover who she really was
needs: To accept that she can create a new identity based on who she chooses to be now, not who she was
voice_markers: Precise, technical language when discussing memory systems
Tendency to speak in questions when uncertain about herself
Becomes clipped and direct under stress
contradiction: Dedicated to preserving authentic memories while living with fabricated ones

relationships.Marcus Webb: Distrust evolving to partnership - he represents everything she's sworn to stop
relationships.The Archivist: Fascination and dependency - the AI knows her real history
relationships.Dr. Yuki Tanaka: Resentment toward the creator of her false existence
relationships.Jin 'Ghost' Park: Kinship with another person of uncertain identity

physical_description: Mid-30s (subjective age), East Asian features, neural implant visible at temple, professional corporate appearance that gradually deteriorates through trilogy
background: Believes she's been a vault curator for 8 years. Actually a Composite created 2 years ago from multiple sources to infiltrate the memory preservation system. Her base memories come from a real Aria Chen who died in a vault breach.

character_arc.book_1: Discovers inconsistencies in her own memories, goes from loyal employee to conspiracy investigator
character_arc.book_2: Learns she's a Composite spy, faces identity crisis, must choose between programming and free will
character_arc.book_3: Accepts constructed identity, fights to protect The Last Original, ultimately sacrifices her consciousness to prevent future memory manipulation
